alert.note: Alert for Gaston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 5:40PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Gaston. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways possible, flooding of low-lying areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 537 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy tropical showers continuing to redevelop and overspread Gaston County. It is possible that rainfall could top 3 inches in spots this evening, leading to elevated stream levels and flooding of low lying areas, especially along the I-85 corridor and greater Gastonia. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gastonia, Northwest Charlotte, Kings Mountain, Mt Holly, Belmont, Cherryville, Bessemer City, South Gastonia, Dallas, Stanley, Cramerton, Lowell, Ranlo, High Shoals, Mcadenville, Crowders Mountain State Park, Lake Wylie, Kings Mountain State Park, Crowders and Crouse. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
